title: Contributing to mbquartR

title: Contributing to mbquartR
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure author agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex can (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to mbquartR
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("alex-koiter/mbquartR", fork = TRUE). Install development dependencies devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number.

title: Contributing to mbquartR
text: New code try follow tidyverse style guide Use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. Use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: Two examples of using mbquartR
text: mbquartR package created help people easily identify, search, locate parcels land using Manitoba legal descriptions. legal land descriptions originate Dominion Land Survey system, introduced late 19th century organize European settlement colonization Western Canada. two main ways mbquartR can used. Search locate parcels land using legal land descriptions (e.g., SW-9-8-6E1) Search legal land description using coordinates (latitude longitude) Note: examples fictitious scenarios designed highlight functionality mbquartR package. identified land parcels coordinates intended official practical use.

what: Example 1: Using legal land description to find the locations of archived soil samples
title: Two examples of using mbquartR
text: Since 1926, Manitoba Soil Survey working quantify map soil properties (texture, parent material, stoniness, pH, salinity etc) support sustainable agricultural development across province. Part soil survey included collecting soil samples chemical analysis (Carbon content). resulted rich archive soil samples spanning eight decades. Recently interest reanalyzing archived soil samples using new technology. However, location many older soil samples identified solely quarter section description. many people, including , familiar enough land survey system easily locate . 900,000 entries Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data covering 600,000 km2. mapping services also unable search legal land description (e.g., Google Maps) makes identifying soil sample taken difficult! explanation quarter sections land types, please visit Get started page.

text: can now use search_legal() find center coordinates (latitude longitude) parcels land data frame. use function need supply vector contains legal land descriptions interest. return data frame includes type land division coordinates centre.
code: location_1 <- search_legal(x = soil_soc$legal) #> Warning in search_legal(x = soil_soc$legal): One or more of the legal land descriptions has an ambiguous meridian value E and is assumed to be east of prime meridian (E1). #> To stop messages please specify meridians as E1 or E2 (e.g., NW-36-89-11E1). location_1 #> # A tibble: 4 × 4 #>   legal             type     long   lat #>   <chr>             <chr>   <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 NE-22-8-1E1       Quarter -97.4  49.7 #> 2 NW-10-9-1E1       Quarter -97.4  49.7 #> 3 SW-14-8-2E1       Quarter -97.2  49.7 #> 4 RL-22-St. Norbert RL      -97.1  49.7

what: Example 2: Using coordinates to find parcels of land
title: Two examples of using mbquartR
text: agri-environmental scientist take lot soil samples farms part research projects always geo-locate sampling sites can revisit later date. reporting results back producers/farmers often easiest refer locations legal land descriptions descriptions familiar tied farmers manage land. example presents small data frame surface soil sample P concentrations (ppm), collected watershed, along corresponding coordinates.

previous_headings: Introduction > Example 2: Using coordinates to find parcels of land
title: Two examples of using mbquartR
text: Using search_coord() provide coordinates, decimal degrees, searches quarter section, land division type, based shortest euclidean distance centre parcel land. data search big function can take little run. function returns legal land description, land division type, center coordinates, user coordinates, distance user provided coordinates centre coordinates. example collected soil samples two different farm fields happen within quarter section
code: location_2 <- search_coord(lat = soil_p$lat, long = soil_p$long) location_2 #> # A tibble: 4 × 7 #>   legal       type     long   lat long_user lat_user dist #>   <chr>       <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>  [m] #> 1 NW-29-4-7W1 Quarter -98.4  49.3     -98.4     49.3 414. #> 2 NW-29-4-7W1 Quarter -98.4  49.3     -98.4     49.3 370. #> 3 SE-2-5-7W1  Quarter -98.3  49.4     -98.3     49.4 361. #> 4 SE-7-5-6W1  Quarter -98.3  49.4     -98.3     49.4 168.

previous_headings: Introduction > Example 2: Using coordinates to find parcels of land
title: Two examples of using mbquartR
text: quick reference can quickly plot centre coordinates approximate boundaries quarter sections using map_quarter(). can also add sampling locations map first converting original data frame sf object. adding sf object additional layer
code: map_quarter(location_2) #> Polygons for quarter sections are approximate and are only meant as #>     a visual aid. point <- sf::st_as_sf(soil_p, coords = c("long", "lat"),                       crs = "+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84") map_quarter(location_2) +    mapview::mapview(point, col.regions = "black",                     color = "black", legend =FALSE) #> Polygons for quarter sections are approximate and are only meant as #>     a visual aid.

title: mbquartR
text: goal mbquartR provide easy way download Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data DataMB locate quarter sections, types land division types, province Manitoba. can search legal land description (e.g., NE-11-33-29W1) lat/long coordinates (e.g., -101.4656, 51.81913). also convenient map function plots centres outline quarter sections map. Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data set covers entire province Manitoba 900,000 parcels land legal land description. mbquartR created work geospatial data Manitoba, particularly working rural farm parcels land legal land description commonly used method identifying location. mbquartR also allows users quickly go back forth geographic coordinates legal land description. mapping applications (e.g., Google Maps) can find route legal land description, can coordinates!

title: mbquartR
text: can install development version mbquartR like :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("alex-koiter/mbquartR")

title: mbquartR
text: quarter section Manitoba land unit measuring 160 acres (~64.8 ha), representing quarter square mile. originates Dominion Land Survey system, introduced late 19th century organize European settlement colonization Western Canada. grid system covers province Manitoba organizes land hierarchy quarter sections, sections, townships, ranges. quarter section square parcel land measuring 1/4 mile 1/4 mile section square parcel land measuring 1 mile 1 mile consists four quarter sections, quarter section indicated cardinal direction corners section (NW, NE, SW, SE) township consists grid 36 sections, sections numbered “S” pattern, starting northeast corner section 1 ending southeast corner section 36 range vertical column townships running north-south numbered east west designated Principal Meridian

previous_headings: mbquartR > What is a quarter section?
what: How do legal land descriptions for quarter section work in Manitoba?
title: mbquartR
text: legal land description quarter section consists four values separated - Quarter Section (SW) Section (9) Township (8) Range (6E1) example: legal land description SW-9-8-6E1 can interpreted Southwest Quarter Section 9, Township 8, Range 6 East 1st Meridian.

title: mbquartR
text: Quarter sections common type land division Manitoba types. size, shape, naming convention types land divisions can different. include: RL = River lot (e.g., RL-11-Oak Island) Lot = Township lot (e.g., 10-54-27W1) OT = Outer two mile lot (e.g., OT-11A-St. Clements) PL = Parish lot (e.g., PL-R-St. Andrews) SL = Settlement lot (e.g., SL-2-Roman Catholic Mission Property) WL = Wood lot (e.g., WL-179-Portage La Prairie) types land division can also search using search_legal()

what: Download the data set from DataMB
title: mbquartR
text: use search functions must first download dataset legal land descriptions coordinates center quarter section Manitoba. basic examples shows two common ways search quarter sections:
code: quarters_dl()

title: mbquartR
text: function takes coordinates (decimal degrees) locates nearest centre quarter section based euclidean distance two points. Given quarter sections half mile square (804.7m 804.7m) furthest distance center corner ~570m. get warning distances greater 600m error distance greater 1000m. tibble returned provides legal land descriptions, centre coordinates, user provided coordinates, distance coordinates provided closest quarter section centre.
code: search_coord(long = c(-101.4656, -99.99768), lat = c(51.81913, 49.928926)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   legal         type     long   lat long_user lat_user  dist #>   <chr>         <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   [m] #> 1 NE-11-33-29W1 Quarter -101.  51.8     -101.     51.8  29.9 #> 2 NW-15-11-19W1 Quarter -100.  49.9     -100.     49.9 211.

title: mbquartR
text: function takes legal land descriptions locates centre coordinates quarter sections. can include leading zeroes (e.g., NE-01-012-12E1) (e.g., NE-1-12-12E1). data set used package includes three meridians (W1, E1, E2); however, commonly searched quarter sections use East 1 (E1) West 1 (W1) meridians. meridian number included default 1. example, search NW-36-89-11E default search NW-36-89-11E1 despite NW-36-89-11E2 existing data set.
code: search_legal(x = c("NE-11-33-29W1", "SW-20-02-1W1")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   legal         type      long   lat #>   <chr>         <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 NE-11-33-29W1 Quarter -101.   51.8 #> 2 SW-20-2-1W1   Quarter  -97.6  49.1

title: mbquartR
text: can also quickly plot center coordinates outline (polygon) located quarter sections interactive map. Outlines provided quarter sections dimensions orientation land division types vary.
code: example <- search_legal(x = c("NE-1-12-12E1", "NE-11-33-29W1")) map_quarter(example) #> Polygons for quarter sections are approximate and are only meant as #>     a visual aid.

title: Finding Manitoba Quarter Sections
text: goal mbquartR provide easy way download Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data DataMB locate quarter sections, land division types, province Manitoba. can search legal land description (e.g., NE-11-33-29W1) lat/long coordinates (e.g., -101.4656, 51.81913). also convenient map function plots centres outlines (polygons) quarter sections map. Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data set covers entire province Manitoba 900,000 parcels land legal land description. mbquartR created work geospatial data Manitoba, particularly working rural farm parcels land legal land description commonly used method identifying location. mbquartR also allows users quickly go back forth geographic coordinates legal land description. mapping applications (e.g., Google Maps) can find route legal land description, can coordinates! Checkout mbquartR website vignettes/code examples.

title: Quickly find MB quarter sections on a map — map_quarter
text: Leaflet map

title: Quickly find MB quarter sections on a map — map_quarter
text: Map displays centre point estimates boundaries quarter sections. Map locations using data frame must include column named legal containing legal land descriptions. Map locations using vector legal land descriptions.

title: Quickly find MB quarter sections on a map — map_quarter
code: search1 <- search_legal(x = c("NE-11-33-29W1", "SW-20-2-1W1")) map_quarter(x = search1) #> Polygons for quarter sections are approximate and are only meant as #>     a visual aid.  search2 <- search_coord(long = c(-101.4656, -99.99768), lat = c(51.81913, 49.928926)) map_quarter(x = search2) #> Polygons for quarter sections are approximate and are only meant as #>     a visual aid.  search3 <- c("NE-11-33-29W1", "SW-20-2-1W1") map_quarter(x = search3) #> Polygons for quarter sections are approximate and are only meant as #>     a visual aid.

what: Finding Manitoba, Canada, quarter sections made easier — mbquartR-package
title: Finding Manitoba, Canada, quarter sections made easier — mbquartR-package
text: mbquartR R package locating quarter sections Manitoba using lat/long coordinates legal land descriptions using Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data set DataMB website (https://geoportal.gov.mb.ca/).

title: Finding Manitoba, Canada, quarter sections made easier — mbquartR-package
text: four main functions package: Download Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions data set quarters_dl() Search legal land descriptions using lat long coordinates search_coord() Search lat long coordinates using legal land descriptions search_legal() Plot search results interactive map map_quarter()

title: Finding Manitoba, Canada, quarter sections made easier — mbquartR-package
text: Maintainer: Alex Koiter koitera@brandonu.ca (ORCID)

what: Download the MB quarter section data — quarters_dl
title: Download the MB quarter section data — quarters_dl
text: Downloads full list quarter sections coordinates Manitoba Geoportal. Note Geoportal unavailable, data downloaded archived version package repository Github.

title: Download the MB quarter section data — quarters_dl
code: quarters_dl(force = FALSE, ask = TRUE, quiet = FALSE)

title: Download the MB quarter section data — quarters_dl
text: force Logical. TRUE, forces re-download data. Note data require regular () updates. ask Logical. TRUE, ask create cache folder MB quarter section data quiet Logical. TRUE, suppresses status messages downloading data

title: Download the MB quarter section data — quarters_dl
text: Nothing. side effect downloading .csv file Manitoba Original Survey Legal Descriptions coordinates cache folder (cache_dir()).

title: Download the MB quarter section data — quarters_dl
text: data set static.

code: if (FALSE) { # interactive() quarters_dl()  }

what: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
title: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
text: Find quarter section(s) legal division types closest provided coordinates. Returns legal land description. Users must use provide coordinates decimal degree format.

title: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
code: search_coord(long, lat)

title: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
text: long Numeric. Vector longitudes (decimal degree) resolution one hundred thousandth degree. Values outside bounds return error (-102.0 -88.9 degrees). lat Numeric. Vector latitudes (decimal degree) resolution one hundred thousandth degree. Values outside bounds return error (49.0 60.0 degrees).

title: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
text: tibble centre latitude longitude coordinates, corresponding legal land descriptions, land division type, user provided latitude longitude coordinates, distance metres provided coordinates centre closest quarter section.

title: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
text: longitudinal extent Manitoba ranges approximately -102.0 -88.9 degrees (negative values indicate western hemisphere). latitudinal extent Manitoba ranges approximately 49.0 60.0 degrees (positive values indicate northern hemisphere). legal land description consists four values separated - Quarter Section (SW) Section (9) Township (8) Range (6E1) example: legal land description SW-9-8-6E1 can interpreted Southwest Quarter Section 9, Township 8, Range 6 East 1st Meridian. #' land division types can different naming conventions include: RL = River lot (e.g., RL-11-Oak Island) Lot = Township lot (e.g., 10-54-27W1) OT = Outer two mile lot (e.g., OT-11A-St. Clements) PL = Parish lot (e.g., PL-R-St. Andrews) SL = Settlement lot (e.g., SL-2-Roman Catholic Mission Property) WL = Wood lot (e.g., WL-179-Portage La Prairie)

title: Search for the nearest quarter section using latitude and longitude — search_coord
code: search_coord(long = c(-101.4656, -99.99768), lat = c(51.81913, 49.928926)) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   legal         type     long   lat long_user lat_user  dist #>   <chr>         <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   [m] #> 1 NE-11-33-29W1 Quarter -101.  51.8     -101.     51.8  29.9 #> 2 NW-15-11-19W1 Quarter -100.  49.9     -100.     49.9 211.  x <- data.frame(long = c(-101.4656, -99.9976), lat = c(51.81913, 49.92892)) search_coord(long = x$long, lat = x$lat) #> # A tibble: 2 × 7 #>   legal         type     long   lat long_user lat_user  dist #>   <chr>         <chr>   <dbl> <dbl>     <dbl>    <dbl>   [m] #> 1 NE-11-33-29W1 Quarter -101.  51.8     -101.     51.8  29.9 #> 2 NW-15-11-19W1 Quarter -100.  49.9     -100.     49.9 211.

what: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
title: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
text: Find centre coordinates quarter sections legal division types using legal land description.

title: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
code: search_legal(x)

title: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
text: x Character. Vector quarter section legal land descriptions wish search .

title: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
text: tibble legal land descriptions, division type, corresponding latitude longitude coordinates.

title: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
text: legal land description quarter section consists four values separated - Quarter Section (SW) Section (9) Township (8) Range (6E1) example: legal land description SW-9-8-6E1 can interpreted Southwest Quarter Section 9, Township 8, Range 6 East 1st Meridian. search_legal() takes legal land descriptions locates centre coordinates quarter sections. can include leading zeroes (e.g., NE-01-012-12E1) (e.g., NE-1-12-12E1). data set used package includes three meridians (W1, E1, E2); however, commonly searched quarter sections use East 1 (E1) West 1 (W1) meridians. meridian number included default 1. example, search NW-36-89-11E default search NW-36-89-11E1 despite NW-36-89-11E2 existing data set. land division types can different naming conventions include: RL = River lot (e.g., RL-11-Oak Island) Lot = Township lot (e.g., 10-54-27W1) OT = Outer two mile lot (e.g., OT-11A-St. Clements) PL = Parish lot (e.g., PL-R-St. Andrews) SL = Settlement lot (e.g., SL-2-Roman Catholic Mission Property) WL = Wood lot (e.g., WL-179-Portage La Prairie)

title: Search for the coordinates of MB quarter sections — search_legal
code: search_legal(x = c("NE-11-33-29W", "SW-20-2-1W")) #> # A tibble: 2 × 4 #>   legal         type      long   lat #>   <chr>         <chr>    <dbl> <dbl> #> 1 NE-11-33-29W1 Quarter -101.   51.8 #> 2 SW-20-2-1W1   Quarter  -97.6  49.1
